summary: Feature request to allow querying the port and address from TestWorkflowEnvironment when using a random free port with createLocal(), enabling manual client creation without needing to pass the address separately to the application.
userImpact: Users must use undocumented APIs or pass port/address separately when creating clients with randomly allocated ports in tests.
rootCause: TestWorkflowEnvironment.createLocal() does not expose a public API to query the allocated port/address when using random free ports.
proposedFix: Add a public method to TestWorkflowEnvironment to query the port/address (similar to the undocumented native.ephemeralServerGetTarget approach).
workaround: Use native.ephemeralServerGetTarget(env["server"]) to access the internal server target.
resolutionDetails: Feature was implemented to expose port/address query capability in TestWorkflowEnvironment.
keyQuote: Allow querying the port/address so it's possible to use a random free port when creating clients manually.
